After logging in for the first time, every student must change his password. If the student is over 14 years old, he must also give his electronic consent so that he can use the {{title}} .

text.errorLDAPTimeout: LDAP timeout - Possible reasons are: incorrect server data, SSL certificates (ldaps) not officially signed, incorrect user data for the search user, incorrect root path, incorrect user path, incorrect class path or incorrect role- LDAP paths . If you cannot solve the problem, contact support.
text.furtherInfoHere: Further information on LDAP configuration can be found in our Help section.
text.onlyProtocolLDAP: LDAP is only possible via the secure protocol of ldaps!
text.verification: After verification, you can preview the contents that have been read out. Deleted contents are not transferred because the user's first name, last name and / or e-mail address is not available in the LDAP.

headline.checkTheSynchronizationOfTheDataAvailabl: Check the synchronization of the data in the LDAP for the new school year

text.onThisPageYouWillFindTheData: On this page you will find the data of all classes and users, as {{shortTitle}} takes it over from your LDAP. Please check the data on a random basis for its correctness before transferring it by ending the transfer phase.

text.afterVerificationCanPreviewTheReadConten: After verification, you can preview the contents that have been read out. Deleted contents are not transferred because the user's first name, surname and / or email address is not available in the LDAP.
text.anyChangesToTheFollowingConfiguration: Any changes to the following configuration may result in the login no longer working for you and all users in your school. Therefore, only make changes if you are aware of the consequences. Some sections are read-only. However, you can enable editing of the information by clicking on the lock in the respective section. After each verification, your system will be updated and initially set to deactivated. Do not forget to finally save the changes if the verification was successful.
text.backgroundSoThatEveryStudentAndTeacher: Background: So that every student and every teacher can access content from previous classes (e.g. class trip photos), the HPI school cloud saves which school year a user was in which class. The HPI school cloud provides a transfer phase so that this works in conjunction with your LDAP and the classes that are synchronized from it. This is the procedure during a school year change:
text.canCreateYearIndependentClasses: You can create independent classes with free names. These classes cannot be 'moved' by the administrator, but must be updated manually.
text.canStartTheTransferPhase: You can start the transfer phase manually from two weeks before the start of the holidays
text.ifAllStudentsAndParentsHaveGiven: If the consent has been given by all students and parents in paper form, the consent for the whole class can be declared manually here.
text.ifThereIsNoManualStart: if there is no manual start at the beginning of the holiday, the transfer phase begins automatically
text.newUsersClassAffiliations: new added users, class memberships and changes to user data are constantly synchronized
text.provideStudentsAndTheirParents: Provide your students and their parents with individual links to give their consent in digital or analog form. When registration is complete, a login password will be created for the student.
text.theNewSchoolYearStartsInThe: The new school year begins in the {{title}} with the preparation time one week before the end of the summer vacation. Regardless of this, you can make changes to the classes for the current, past and coming school year at any time.
text.thereIsNoDeclarationOfConsent: There is no consent form for the user yet. Call a personal invitation link to complete the registration and distribute it to the user or his parents. During registration, the consent is then granted by the user himself. If a declaration of consent is available in paper form, the user can be activated by clicking on 'Received consent on paper' and a start password can be assigned. This will unlock the login.
text.theSchoolYearEndsAnd: The school year {{schoolName}} is ended and the transfer phase to the new school year begins. This step cannot be undone. No classes and users can be created or changed during this time.
text.theSynchronizationOfLDAPMasterData: The synchronization of LDAP master data is interrupted during the transfer phase. This means that user data and classes (if used) are no longer updated via LDAP. It is still possible to log in with login data that has already been synchronized. Password changes in the LDAP during login are also taken into account.
text.useTheTransferPhaseAroundTheSchool: Use the transfer phase around the change of school year to adjust class affiliation and personal data in the LDAP. Finally, transfer all changes to the HPI school cloud at once.
text.withAllChangesAndSettings: With all modifications and settings in the administration area, you confirm that you are an authorized school administrator and you are authorized to make modifications in the school in the HPI school cloud. Your click is insofar considered as instruction of the school to the HPI.
text.wouldYouLikeReportABug: Would you like to report an error or do you have an idea to improve the {{title}} ? Send requests or problems directly to the {{shortTitle}} user support.

text.ifChatsAreActivatedAtYourSchoolTeamAdmin: If chats are enabled at your school, team administrators in the respective team can specifically unlock the chat function.
text.ifMatrixIsActivatedAtYourSchool: If the Matrix Messenger is activated, all teachers in this school can start chat rooms, private conversations or group discussions within the course or team. Students initially  have read-only access, but can also be given write access via the course and team settings. Students can also start private chats within courses and teams. You can find more information about this in the
text.ifVideoConferenceAreActivatedAtYourSchoo: If video conferencing is enabled at your school, teachers can add the video conferencing tool to their course in the Tools section and then start video conferencing for all course participants from there. Team administrators can activate the video conference function in the respective team. Team leaders and team admins can then add and start video conferences for appointments.

you can make the necessary changes for the new school year in the
LDAP (new users, update classes)

text.loginViaLDAP: Login via LDAP is still possible for existing users
text.messengerSchoolRoom:
The announcement chat room enables school administrators to send messages to the entire school. 
Students only have read access to this room, but they can see each other and thus start private chats.
text.messengerStudentRoomCreate: If this feature is enabled, students are allowed to create chat rooms, private conversations and course and team discussions. These rooms are not visible to teachers unless they are explicitly invited.

text.forGeneralQuestionsPleaseContact: If you have any general questions, please contact the following e-mail address:

text.hereIsOurRegistrationFormMINT: New STEM EC schools can register here:
text.inBrandenburgTheAdmissionOfNewSchools: In Brandenburg, the admission of new schools is coordinated together with the DigitalAgentur Brandenburg (ILB) and the MBJS.
text.inMarch2020ZENSOSQueries: In March 2020, ZENSOS queries were last used to determine the need of our infrastructure at the schools. The resulting registrations are currently being processed.
text.inNiedersachsenTheReferenceSchool: In Lower Saxony, the reference school network n-21 is responsible for the admission of new schools.
text.inThuringiaTheThuringianInstitute: In Thuringia, the Thuringian Institute for Teacher Training, Curriculum Development and Media (ThILLM) is responsible for the admission of new schools.
text.MINTECSchoolsAnd: MINT-EC is the national excellence network of schools with upper secondary level and a distinctive profile in mathematics, computer science and natural sciences and technology (MINT). Schools from the network have been participating in the HPI School Cloud project since 2017.
text.ourPartnerOfMINIECAlso: Our partner of MINT-EC also offers regular webinars on the HPI school cloud. The new dates can be found here:
text.pleaseContactEither: Please contact either Ms. Julia Günther:
text.pleaseContactTheFollowingEmailAddress: Please contact the following e-mail address to start the registration process:
text.SchoolsAndOther: Schools that do not belong to a state project can register here. Thanks to the project extension by the BMBF, they can now use the HPI school cloud.
text.theCentralOfficeForSchools: The Central Agency for German Schools Abroad (ZfA) supports you in the registration process.
text.youCanGetSupport: Support in familiarizing with the school cloud and creating first content can be found here:
text.youWillThenBeGiven: You will then be given all the necessary information so that you can start soon.

headline.learningNuggetDataProtectioin: Learning nugget: Privacy in everyday school routine
headline.learningNuggetDataProtectionAndCloud: Learning nugget: Privacy and cloud solutions
headline.learningNuggetLicenseModels: Learning nugget: license models and usage rights
headline.welcomeToTheOnlineCourse: Welcome to the online course 'Privacy and Copyright'

text.aLearningUnitLasts: A learning unit lasts a maximum of 15 minutes. In order to receive the full scope of the contents, it is best to connect loudspeakers or headphones to your device.
text.byTheWayYouWillAlways: By the way, you will always receive a certificate of participation as proof of your learning success at the end of a learning nugget.
text.clientAndLicensedFor: Client and licensed for: Verein MINT-EC®,
text.contentAndProduction: Content and production: youknow GmbH, St.-Martin-Straße 57, 81669 Munich,
text.createdAsPartOfThe: Developed as part of the HPI school cloud project.
text.dealingWithPersonalDetails: The handling of personal data, the requirements of a cloud solution in school routine and the digital sharing of teaching and learning materials repeatedly cause uncertainty among school administrators and teachers.
text.forThisReasonYouHaveTheOpportunity: For this reason, you have the opportunity to learn everything you need to know about data protection and copyright in small learning units.
text.hereIsTheLearningNugget: Click here for the learning nugget:
text.inTheLearningNuggetOnDataProtection: In the learning nugget on data protection in school routine, you can find out which data protection regulations you must observe in the context of school. We also show specific data protection cases from school routine here.
text.inThisLessonYouWillLearnAllTheBasics: In this learning unit, you will learn all the basics of personal data. You will also get an overview of the five basic principles applicable in dealing with the GDPR.
text.learningNiggetsImproveTheLearningEffect: Learning nuggets improve the learning effect and are also fun. In addition, thanks to the modular structure, you can freely decide which learning unit you want to execute first. Simply click on the respective learning nugget to take the training.
text.whatAreTheAdvantagesAndDisadvantages: What are the advantages and disadvantages of cloud solutions in school use? What should be considered for use at your school? In this learning unit, we introduce everything you need to know about cloud solutions such as the HPI school cloud.
text.withTheTopicsOfLicenseModels: With regard to licensing models and right of use, you will be informed about the basics of copyright law and the requirements for reproducing materials in analogous and digital school routine. You can also learn what Open Educational Resources are and how to identify licenses adequately.

Without prior written permission, a commercial distribution of the contents available via the {{shortTitle}} is explicitly prohibited, unless they are explicitly marked. The editorial responsibility for the content of linked websites of other providers (including links to third parties), in particular the responsibility for compliance with the regulations of the law for the protection of minors and data privacy, is in every respect the sole responsibility of the respective provider.
text.theHassoPlattnerInstituteRegularlyChecks: The Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI) regularly checks and updates the contents of its websites. Despite the greatest possible care, we cannot rule out that individual information on our website is out of date or no longer correct. Therefore, we cannot accept liability for the up-to-datedness, accuracy and completeness of the information published. The same applies to all websites that can be accessed from the HPI pages via hyperlinks. The following applies to all these links: We expressly declare that we have no influence on the design and content of the linked site. Therefore we hereby distance ourselves from all contents of all linked pages and do not adopt their contents as our own. This declaration applies to all links on our site to external sites. The HPI is not responsible for the content of these linked pages. Furthermore, the HPI reserves the right to make changes and additions to the information displayed at any time. The content and structure of the HPI website are protected by copyright. The further use of information and data is only permitted with our consent. We wish you an informative stay on our website and look forward to your suggestions, wishes or criticism

text.TheProjectIsANonCommercialPilotProject: The {{shortTitle}} is a non-commercial pilot project, which is carried out by the HPI in cooperation with the national Excellence School Network MINT-EC (''https://www.mint-ec.de/'') and is funded by the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) (for more information see: ''https://hpi.de/schul-cloud'').

headline.valueStatement: The HPI school cloud development is characterized by
headline.access: Low-threshold access to digital teaching content
headline.furtherInformation: More information on getting started in the {{shortTitle}}

img_alt.text: Students sit together and use the {{shortTitle}} on their mobile devices.

text.welcome: "Learning with digital media is the most dynamic challenge. This requires a high-performance, digital infrastructure. One of the most important projects is the {{shortTitle}} developed at the Hasso Plattner Institute (HPI). Its aim is to network the state's schools so that teachers and students have access to learning and teaching materials anytime, anywhere. The professional central maintenance for all schools significantly reduces the administrative and support effort. We expect the {{shortTitle}} to give a significant boost to digital education and are looking forward to the start of the project." – Minister of Education Britta Ernst at the opening event on May 2, 2019.
text.registration: A uniform digital platform for the whole school offers many advantages. Registration for the {{shortTitle}} is therefore carried out by the school management. Please contact brandenburg@hpi-schul-cloud.org, if you want to register your school. All students will then receive a registration link or login data from their school for the initial registration in the {{shortTitle}}. If you have any questions about registering for the first time, please contact the technical director of your school or the respective teacher.
text.valueStatement:
• a consistent use of open source solutions,
  • a consistently user-centered development,
  • a strictly modular structure,
  • which is important for a large country Function of cross-school cooperation,
  • the EU-DSGVO/data protection conformity through privacy by design,
  • the possibility of creating synergies through national cooperation.
text.access: A modern teaching and learning infrastructure is indispensable in order to lead the digital transformation in the education sector to success and to optimally prepare children at school for life in an increasingly digital society.
text.advantages:
• Time and place-independent access to a large range of digital learning content
  • Exchange of digital, self-created materials
  • Digital education beyond separate computer rooms
  • Professional maintenance
  • Constant availability of the latest software for teachers and students
  • IT applications comply with the latest security standards
  • Contact point for new digital learning opportunities
  • Direct feedback from users
  • Suggestion for self-determined learning
  • Provision of specially designed learning offers
  • Networking of different learning locations

text.welcome: "The Hasso Plattner Institute for digital engineering developed the HPI Schul-Cloud under the direction of Prof. Dr. Christoph Meinel and together with MINT-EC , the national excellence school network of over 300 schools nationwide, and supported by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research. It is intended to create the technical basis for teachers and students to also use modern digital teaching and learning content in every subject, in the same way as apps can be used via smartphones or tablets. This is the open instance of the HPI Schul-Cloud through which individual schools can have access to the platform.

The {{shortTitle}} is intended to create the technical basis for teachers and students to use modern digital teaching and learning content in every subject, in the same way as apps can be used on smartphones or tablets. To achieve this goal the state of Thuringia is piloting the Schul-Cloud developed by the Hasso Plattner Institute with initially 20 pilot schools and 9 study seminars from the school year 2019/2020.
